p: Fear of discrimination and of exploitation, exacerbated by lack of trust in the healthcare system, is the single factor that can undermine effective biobanking efforts in Liberia. To help re-establish lost trust and for ethical, fair and successful biobanking, it is necessary to engage participants and communities by giving them information, empowering them with greater decision-making over the use of their data/samples, setting up clear mechanisms for accountability and good governance and lastly and most importantly, implementing fair benefit sharing plans.
